results.name: Triangular array T read by rows: T(j,1) = 1 for ((j-1) mod 6) < 3, else 0; T(j,k) = T(j-1,k-1) + T(j,k-1) for 2 <= k <= j.
comment: All columns are periodic with period length 6. The (3+6*i)-th row equals the first (3+6*i) terms of main diagonal (i >= 0).
link: Michel Marcus, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
example: First seven rows of T are
mathematica: T[j_, 1] := If[Mod[j-1, 6]<3, 1, 0]; T[j_, k_] := T[j, k] = T[j-1, k-1]+T[j, k-1]; Table[T[j, k], {j, 1, 13}, {k, 1, j}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 06 2014 *)
program: (PARI) {m=13; M=matrix(m, m); for(j=1, m, M[j, 1]=if((j-1)%6<3, 1, 0)); for(k=2, m, for(j=k, m, M[j, k]=M[j-1, k-1]+M[j, k-1])); for(j=1, m, for(k=1, j, print1(M[j, k], ",")))}

(MAGMA) m:=13; M:=ZeroMatrix(IntegerRing(), m, m); for j:=1 to m do if (j-1) mod 6 lt 3 then M[j, 1]:=1; end if; end for; for k:=2 to m do for j:=k to m do M[j, k]:=M[j-1, k-1]+M[j, k-1]; end for; end for; &cat[ [ M[j, k]: k in [1..j] ]: j in [1..m] ];
xref: Cf. A129339 (main diagonal of T), A131023 (first subdiagonal of T), A131024 (row sums of T), A131025 (antidiagonal sums of T). First through sixth column of T are in A088911, A131026, A131027, A131028, A131029, A131030 resp.
